servermodel

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • servermodel.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the board for GO. Final exercise module 1 Nedap University.
    Author:
    Linda.Meekhof

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      The constructor creates an empty playing board

        public void boardInit(int dim)

      • deepCopy

        public Board deepCopy()
        Creates a deep copy of this field. THis can be useful for trying positions and for the rule: No stone may be played so as to recreate any previous board position

      • getFields

        public Stone getFields(int i)
        Returns the content of the field. This can be Stone.b, Stone.w or Stone.__
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the field
        Returns:
        the Stone of the field

      • getField

        public Stone getField(int row,
                      int col)
        Returns the content of the field. This can be Stone.b, Stone.w or Stone.__. Requires the method index(row, col).
        Parameters:
        row -
        col -
        Returns:
        the Stone on the field (b, w, or empty)

      • setFields

        public void setFields(int i,
                      Stone stone)
        This method sets the field, indicated with the index i, to the given stone parameter.
        Parameters:
        i - is the index of the field.
        stone - is the given Stone mark to be placed.

      • setField

        public void setField(int row,
                     int col,
                     Stone stone)
        This method sets the field, indicated with row and col, to the given stone parameter.
        Parameters:
        row - is the field's row.
        col - is the field's column.
        stone - is the given Stone mark to be placed.
        Throws:
        InvalidCoordinateException

      • index

        public int index(int row,
                 int col)
        Calculates the index in the linear array of fields from a (row, col) pair. When DIM = 19 the linear array consist of 361 index numbers.
        Returns:
        the index belonging to the (row,col)-field

      • isField

        public boolean isField(int index)
        Returns true if the index of a field is a valid index. When DIM = 19 the linear array consist of 361 index numbers.
        Returns:
        true if 0<= index < DIM*DIM (Use in TUI to indicate if it is a valid field). overbodig??

      • isField

        public boolean isField(int row,
                       int col)
        Checks if the row and column input is a field on the board or that it not.
        Parameters:
        row -
        col -
        Returns:
        true if 0 <= row < DIM && 0 <= col < DIM

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Checks if the board is full. In this case not necessary because of the implemented rules there is an infinite loop.
        Returns:

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the board by setting all the fields to Stone.__ (empty field).

      • groupHasLiberties

        public java.lang.Boolean groupHasLiberties(Stonegroup stonechain)
        When a stone or Stonegroup has one liberty, then the group is not captured. The last created Stonegroup should not be evaluated, only after the removing the captured stones of the other player. Then evaluate the last created group of chains.
        Parameters:
        stonechain -
        Returns:

      • gettingNeighbors

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> gettingNeighbors(int row,

        Getting neighbor integers.

        Create a new chaingroup with the last set.
        Parameters:
        row -
        col -
        stoneColor -

      • removeStonesCaptured

        public void removeStonesCaptured()
        When a stonegroup is captured by the other player. These captured stones are removed from the board. Remove the set of stones that are captured. Laatste group niet meerekenen

      • removeStones

        public void removeStones(Stonegroup stonegroup)
        Removes the stones of the board. This are the stones that together are the Stonegroup.
        Parameters:
        stonegroup -

      • updateBoard

        public void updateBoard(int row,
                        int col,
                        Stone stoneColor)
        Updates the board. First evaluating all the stonegroups. Remove the stones that are captured by setting the last stone. Then evaluate the last created stonegroup for capturing.
        Parameters:
        row -
        col -
        stoneColor -

      • isWinner

        public boolean isWinner(Stone stone)
        The winner with the biggest area wins. A player's area consists of all the intersections the player has either occupied or surrounded. In case of an equal score there is a draw.
        Returns:
        the stone color which has won the game.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This gives a String representation of this GO-board.

      • createEmptyFieldChainComplete

        public void createEmptyFieldChainComplete()
        First gather all the empty fields in a list --> emptyFieldList. After that create all the chains, by iterating through the list of emptyFieldList.
